description.text: this message file contains message for [name] package

msg.text: The component '$$s' of type $$s is not supported in this device. \n
$$s : property EFB_UFM cannot be ENABLED since UFM is not supported in this device. \n
$$s : property INIT_DATA cannot be DYNAMIC for this device. \n

BANDGAP turned off dynamically by Power controller '$$s'. When the BANDGAP circuitry is turned off, POR circuitry, analog circuits PLL, oscillator, Inputs (MIPI, LVCMOS18D, LVCMOS25D, LVCMOS33D, LVTTL33D, LVDS25, BLVDS25, MLVDS25 and LVPECL33), Outputs (LVDS25 true only), Bidir (MIPI_LP, LVCMOS18D, LVCMOS25D, LVCMOS33D, LVTTL33D, BLVDS25E and MLVDS25E) are turned off.
Only one Security primitive is allowed in a design.
The Dynamic Bank Controller BCSLEWRATEA '$$s' does not have the BANKID property associated with the bank to control.
The Dynamic Bank Controller BCSLEWRATEA '$$s' is not driven by a signal connected to the SLEWRATEENI port.
Invalid BANKID '$$d' on Dynamic Bank Controller BCSLEWRATEA '$$s'.
More than one instance of Dynamic Bank Controller component BCSLEWRATEA with BANKID '$$d' instantiated ($$s, $$s). Only one can be used.
Input IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component SLEWRATEB '$$s'. SLEWRATE is not applicable for input and will be ignored.
IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component SLEWRATEB '$$s' that has its control signal '$$s' tied to GND. SLEWRATEB is disabled in this case and will be ignored.
IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component SLEWRATEB '$$s' but does not have a BANKID. BANKID is required for SLEWRATE control via bank controller.
BANKID '$$d' on IO component '$$s' is invalid.

IO component '$$s' SLEWRATE power saving usage is being attempted in 2 ways. One using instantiated SLEWRATEB '$$s', the other using bank controller BCSLEWRATE '$$s'. Use on of the ways to program the SLEWRATE.
IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component SLEWRATEB '$$s' that is missing the control signal to port E.

IO component '$$s' is combined with instantiated power saving component SLEWRATEB '$$s' with BANKID $$d and control signal '$$s' that causes conflict with bank controller '$$s' with BANKID $$d and control signal '$$s'.
The Dynamic Bank Controller BCSLEWRATEA '$$s' with BANKID '$$d' does not control any IOs. It will be removed.
BCSLEWRATEA '$$s' bank '$$d' is not supported in the WLCSP package (Only banks 0 and 2 are supported in the WLCSP package).
$$s : Component EFB is not supported in this device. \n
SYSCONFIG 'CONFIGURATION=$$s PRIMARY_BOOT=$$s SECONDARY_BOOT=$$s' is not a legal combination. \n
Embedded Security Block (ESBA user primitive) is not available. Please contact Lattice Customer Service to request license to enable MachXO3D Embedded Security Block feature. \n
Background Reconfiguration function cannot support Distributed RAM block, please refer to TN1292(SED Usage Guide) and TN1279(Programming and Configuration Usage Guide).\n
$$s: No UFM available in the selected device but UFM was enabled in EFB.

UFM was enabled in EFB: Enabling the configuration interface will temporarily disable certain features of the device including Power Controller, GSR, Hardened User SPI Port, Hardened Primary User I2C Port. Functionality is restored after the Flash Memory (UFM/Configuration) Interface is disabled using Disable Configuration Interface command 0x26 followed by Bypass command 0xFF. \n

$$s: CONFIGURATION attribute in Design Planner is set to EXTERNAL. An external memory device is needed for storage of the configuration bitstream and the EBR initial data. The entire UFM array is available as General Purpose Flash Memory.
$$s: The EBR initilization data in the design and the number of initialized UFM pages assigned in IPexpress EFB GUI exceed the UFM array of this device.
$$s: CONFIGURATION attribute in Design Planner is set to $$s. UFM cannot be used as General Purpose Flash Memory for current boot configuration.
$$s: CONFIGURATION attribute in Design Planner is set to CFG. UFM is not better to be used as General Purpose Flash Memory for current boot configuration.
CONFIGURATION must be set to EXTERNAL because both CFG0 and CFG1 are used for UFM, both CFG0 and CFG1 are not available for Image boot.
CONFIGURATION must be set to EXTERNAL because CFG0 is used as UFM, therefore, the CFG0 is not available for Image boot when CUR_DESIGN_BOOT_LOCATION is set to IMAGE_0.
CONFIGURATION must be set to EXTERNAL because CFG1 is used as UFM, therefore, the CFG1 is not available for Image boot when CUR_DESIGN_BOOT_LOCATION is set to IMAGE_1.
